meanings.sent1: She retied her shoelaces to keep them from coming undone.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, he retied the boat securely to the dock.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful clown had to retie his oversized shoes multiple times during the performance.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was like a knot that could never be retied.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor's hands automatically retied the familiar knots with ease.

meanings.sent1: He retied the ribbon on the gift box to make it look presentable.
meanings.sent2: The hiker retied the straps of his backpack before continuing on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept trying to retie the leash around its own neck.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was so strong that it could never be retied by anyone else.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved making a knot disappear and then magically retie itself.
